article.headline: Cent. Arkansas 88, Rhema University 47
article.story: CONWAY, Ark. (AP) -- York Sims scored 14 points and pulled down seven rebounds to lead Central Arkansas to a 88-47 win Tuesday night over Rhema Bible. The Bears dominated Rhema, having as much as a 45-point lead toward the end of the second half. Central Arkansas (6-1) jumped out to a 20-6 lead in the first eight minutes of the game. Landrell Brewer and Nate Bowie contributed 12 points a piece to the Bears' win. Overall, Central Arkansas shot 52 percent from the floor. Rhema (0-9) saw forward Gabe White score 16 points, while Tyron Hall contributed 14 in the loss. The Eagles shot only 32 percent from the floor and center Chad Stewart received a technical foul during the game.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
